title: Naomi Watts dresses up like a chook and does the funky chicken dance
text:
She juggles her successful film career with motherhood.

And on Friday, Naomi Watts took time out of her busy schedule to prepare for Halloween festivities in New York with her two children Alexander (Sasha) Pete, 12, and Samuel Kai, 10.

The award-winning actress, 51, took to Instagram to share a fun post of herself dressed up as a chook doing the funky chicken dance.

She's got the moves! Naomi Watts (pictured) took to Instagram to share a clip of herself doing the funky chicken dance in a hilarious costume for Halloween on Friday

She wrote in the caption: 'My child said... UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES!!!' along with the hashtags: '#happyhalloween' and '#dothefunkychicken'.

The blonde beauty then took to her Instagram Story where she revealed that she instead opted for a Bambi onesie, complete with her face painted as a deer.

She wrote on the photo: 'Went for this instead. Less embarrassing for the children.'

Bless her! Instead of embarrassing her two children Alexander (Sasha) Pete, 12, and Samuel Kai, 10, she opted for a Bambi onesie instead

Naomi was recently honoured with the Orry-Kelly Award at the Australians in Film Awards in LA for her contribution to the entertainment industry.

Naomi, who has starred in critically acclaimed films such as The Impossible and Mulholland Drive, was presented with the award by fellow Aussie Isla Fisher.

At the awards, she said: 'I knew I loved what I did, I loved the job of being an actor, but I didn’t think it would go this far.'

And the winner is: At the Australians in Film Awards in LA, Naomi said: 'I knew I loved what I did, I loved the job of being an actor, but I didn’t think it would go this far'

'It does feel like a very long career at this point and I am grateful that the invitation is still there.'

The prestigious Australians in Film Awards honours the country's most talented figures in the entertainment industry who have made a name for themselves at home and overseas.

Naomi is currently based in New York with her two children who she shares with ex-partner Liev Schreiber, 51.
description: She juggles her successful film career with motherhood.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
